article_text:
Expat stints are getting shorter as companies try to accommodate the needs of working families and younger employees.

A study of 831 multinational firms by consultancy Mercer finds more than half of firms have increased short-term expat assignments, typically lasting from three to 12 months, with more firms planning to follow suit in the near future.
